website_summaries.verdict: This remarkable set of high-quality glow sticks not only lasts for all-night parties, but also works as commercial-grade safety tools.
pros: Glow sticks last for 12 hours and have a five-year shelf life
Waterproof, non-toxic, and non-flammable for supreme safety
cons: Dimmer than some customers were expecting

customer_reviews.title: Dimmer than dollar store glow stick.
customer_reviews.text: After cracking one as a test, I was unimpressed with the brightness. I remembered that I had a 4-5 year old bargain bin glow sticks in one of my medical kits and I grabbed it to do a comparison. The off brand budget stick was at least twice as bright. Very disappointed in what I thought was a brand that could be trusted.
customer_reviews.author: Xac

customer_reviews.title: so disappointing...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased for myself and also sent to my parents. I tried one to test. perhaps useful to get up the stairs in a power loss, but not really worth that. I have a dog with black fur and I could not see the dog on floor in front of me. certainly did not illuminate a room. feeling bad that i wasted money on myself and parents. glad I tested so that they did not ever have to actually rely on them. stick glowed green for 12 hours but does not illuminate.
customer_reviews.author: crow

customer_reviews.title: Great Saftey Lightsticks
customer_reviews.text: The Snaplight 12 hr safety lightsticks perform excellent! Easy to use. Great for my EDC bag and my 72 hr backpack. Definitely a must for a variety of situations. Whether your flashlight is out or broken to being more steathy. Each stick has a hook and hole to hang or secure on a backpack for instance. Essential to any situation; backpacking, keep in vehicle, have some around your home, carry in EDC pack etc. You can't go wrong. Great purchase and would/will buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Reichart

customer_reviews.title: Great product all around
customer_reviews.text: For those of you that may or may not know, Cyalume provides chem lights for the military, so they should be the first stop for most of us. I bought several brands to test out and found the Cyalumes were as good as anything else I could find, and lasted well past the 12 hour mark. In fact, mine were still putting off some dim light at the 24 hour mark! A great product, easy to use, and well packaged. I didn't evaluate them with night-vision, but they are fantastic with regular eyes. :)
customer_reviews.author: Clint F.

customer_reviews.title: Not bright at all. Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty disappointed with these, especially considering the positive reviews. First, the package it hard to open, but whatever. The stick is only about half full. When I cracked them they didn’t seem to produce much light. I’ve used these thick type glow ticks many times when camping or power outages. I dug around and found another brand I bought THREE years ago and cracked that one. That old stick was twice as bright as these new ones! I tried the green and yellow sticks and both were dull. Im sending them back and buying my old, less expensive brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Presley

customer_reviews.title: Effective Years After Expiration
customer_reviews.text: I was recently going through our emergency kits and realized that some of the light sticks that I had were expired. The oldest was use by 2010 (9 years past date). I cracked that light stick that evening and it was still very bright and effective, it even still had some glow left for the following evening! I came back to Amazon to purchase replacement, fresh Cyalume Light Sticks for our kits.
customer_reviews.author: William J

customer_reviews.title: These arrived in a plastic ziplock bag in another bag/not factory packaging.
customer_reviews.text: These arrived in a plastic ziplock bag in another bag, That is not factory packaging or enough protection for snap-on light sticks, I cant trust that these will work when needed, I suspect that someone is re-packing old or counterfeit light sticks. As a courtesy I went ahead and notified the real manufacturer so their legal department can deal with this.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: It's been almost 9 months since we purchased the snap lights and we finally got a chance to use them last night. During an electrical storm, our power was knocked out at around 10pm. We have a three story house, so I placed 1-stick at the bottom of each staircase. 12-hours later both sticks are still glowing bright enough to light up the floor in daylight. I'm grateful to see that the product claims made by Cyalume were kept. The Snaplight gets the job done. Photo attached.
customer_reviews.author: Robbie

customer_reviews.title: More than 12 hours, I got a solid 13+
customer_reviews.text: Did a test at 3:00 PM, woke up next morning at 4:00 AM and in the pitch black was still able to use it to read small print on the back of the shampoo bottle. Another hour it was still going (14 hours) but definitely lost it's brightness by then, could still make out larger letters on things, but no fine print. Writing this at 8:00 AM, 17 hours after snapping it, and I was able to still get enough light out of it to see where a light switch was in a pitch black room if I held it close enough along a wall and "scanned" around. Very impressed overall.
customer_reviews.author: Shopaholic

customer_reviews.title: These are BRIGHT!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these lightsticks to put in my glove compartment for emergencies after dark (such as a flat tire) as flashlight batteries go dead WAY too fast in a hot car. That said, these things are BRIGHT! Like the ones we used in the military. It remained glowing for many hours, much more than 12, but max light output only lasted 4 hours or so before they started to slowly fade (more than enough time to change a tire, find a fuse box, put one in the bathroom during a power outage, etc). These are great value for what you get, they are not at all like those cheap dollar store ones. Very highly recommended, I will be purchasing more!
customer_reviews.author: Scott H

customer_reviews.title: These Are Great
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe how impressed I was with these glow sticks. I don’t know why you’d need anything else. They’re very bright through most of and they give at least a marking amount of light through the advertised duration. The green color doesn’t lend well to some tasks like reading but in a power outage they definitely saved us an incredible amount of battery in our flash lights. They worked great just to give some light in the rooms after dark and mark spots through the house. Glad I had them on hand before and am going to buy more to replace the ones we used.
customer_reviews.author: BF

customer_reviews.title: Bright and last a good amount of time.
customer_reviews.text: They are glow sticks.. what else can you say? I bought these for our vehicles for emergencies. Between one or two of these, a reflective vest, and a bright LED flashlight, we should be easy to spot on the back roads, late at night if we were to break down. In this age of cell phones, this is less of an issue, but I like to be prepared for any circumstance. These items fit easily on our glove boxes.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: A really great product at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: We cracked one open the day they were delivered and were delighted at how bright it was and how long it lasted. At first we could see around an entire room easily - at the 12 hour mark if one was hanging by a doorway you'd be able to see where the exit was. I've got these on the side for emergency use and will be using them for kid's entertainment on Independence Day - much better than those necklaces and safer for kids who are afraid of the sparkers.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Glows for more than 12 hours!
customer_reviews.text: I did plenty on research before buying this product. I compared it to the Military Grade (4 years shelf life, thicker shell, floats, different hook, not as bright, not up to date with Industrial Grade). The Military Grade just meets the standards required for the Military, Industrial Grade is better in my opinion. I took this for fishing last night, it stayed bright for about 4 hours. It's been about 18 hours now, and it's still glowing! Not bright, but glowing. It's a good product, definitely worth the purchase. Will be buying this again
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Cyalume SnapLight Green Glow Sticks
customer_reviews.text: A great product. Brighter and much safer than candles, when there is a power failure. Each stick will glow brightly for a good six hours. You can use them safely without fear of causing a fire. They're safe for children and the elderly to use as they don't get hot, and are virtually unbreakable. Attach a cord and they can be hung from around the neck or wrist. Just a really great product to have on hand when you need a safe form of light.
customer_reviews.author: L. Joyner

customer_reviews.title: Green Calume Light Sticks
customer_reviews.text: Bought these "snap" light sticks to mark our campsite post at night for taking unexpected trips in the middle of the night to the latrine, showering and marking nite time danger zones like guide lines from tents, rocks and uneven ground on our site. They are advertised as 12 hour, but they stayed illuminated for 72 hours but gradually not as bright as the first night. (I think this was because we had a full shade site, and the sun didn't degrade the chemical inside the stick) Still glowing on the last nite. Great for making a kid friendly glo-lantern . Always a family camp favorite!
customer_reviews.author: Divineshadow, Plymouth, WI

customer_reviews.title: were very bright well beyond 12 hours duration
customer_reviews.text: I bought some of these a while ago (Nov 2017) and a year later (Oct 2018) I tested a few of them. They were bright and lasted well over their 12 our stated life. Still making visible light beyond 24 hours. I keep them in my bag, tumbling around loose I was worried about accidentally activating them, but the few I tested did not have any problem with accidentally breaking.
customer_reviews.author: A.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Perfect emergency lighting for marking your path in the woods or the Desert. They’re pretty dim after six hours, but in complete darkness you’ll still be able to see them. Not bad for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Matt G.

customer_reviews.title: worth it for sure
customer_reviews.text: For about a buck apiece you can't beat the deal. they do last 12 hours, although they don't illuminate the room at that point, more like they are just glowing. I use them on campouts, they are nice and bright from dusk 'til we go to bed. They do not come with rope though, so if you want to make a necklace for your kids, bring your own paracord. Probably a good idea to keep the two together now that I think aboutit, maybe I'll use the orange, that should glow nicely. I keep them all over, in camping gear, in house, in get home bags in each vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: klwdesigns

customer_reviews.title: Bright but not functional
customer_reviews.text: They really do last... But not very bright. At first they are bright and does the job but a few hours in its glowing enough to see the glow stick but not really to illuminate very much. Would be good if lost in the darkness... As a beacon...kind of...But not much else. Not something I could reliably use to see by or be visible by from far out. Would be better off with flashlights and extra batteries. Will keep as backup to the backups but will not purchase again from same company.
customer_reviews.author: Tessy

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: Save your money, I bought both red and green, they didn't last 12 hours more like 1 with a faint glow for a few more hours... Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Packaged in a one gallon bag?
customer_reviews.text: These come loose in what appears a one gallon bag. The bag appears to be OEM, not some hack, who threw 20 into a bag and shipped them off. They are still packaged in the foil. They still last a long time. My kid still loves them They still work after riding in the trunk of a car for 2 years. BUT I was hoping to get two boxes of 10, instead if a bag of 20. Outside of that and I know it is nit picking, these are outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch Steel

customer_reviews.title: Recommended from a Survival Dude.
customer_reviews.text: Advertises 12 hours, which it does glow for *checks watch* going on 10 hours now, but not good for illuminating an area after a few hours. It is definitely still visible as a signaling tool for at least ten hours now. Honestly it's brighter after 10 hours than I thought it would be. I was expecting a "well it still technically glows at 12 hours even though you can barely see it" sort of thing, but it it's legit glowing at 10 hours.
customer_reviews.author: JakeF

customer_reviews.title: 24+ hour glow sticks
customer_reviews.text: I am a wedding photographer and sometimes when shooting in rural areas at night it is pitch black. I purchased these glow sticks for my go-bag at first but started using the extras to attach to the feet of my equipment so people don't trip on my light stands at night. I cracked two glows sticks at 21:45 on 8/4/18 and as of the time of this review at 01:55 on 8/6/18 they are at about half their original intensity. For my purposes, these work very well. I'm using them as a primary light source, just as a safety marker and they are working great for thAt
customer_reviews.author: William J. Dabovich

customer_reviews.title: not as bright as the glow sticks from a year ago.
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased these before and been very happy. But because of how they were shipped, I wanted to test a sample to ensure they weren't damaged. I took one and activated it. The light output seemed a little low. So for comparison, I took one I ordered last year, and activated it. Both were activated within 5 minutes of each other. The older one was notably brighter. I don't know if these are old stock or badly stored, but I'm annoyed. These top-tier glow sticks are too expensive to exhibit this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Kurtis B

customer_reviews.title: very bright
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a group father/daughter campout. We broke these open as it got dark, and these sticks were so bright we found that we didn't use our flashlights. The girls enjoyed these all the way back to the cabin. At bed time though, we had to take them away and put them in another room because they were very bright and keeping the dads up. The next morning, the global sticks still had a little juice left in them. Overall, fantastic experience with these
customer_reviews.author: mark d.

customer_reviews.title: Same great quality I’ve come to expect!
customer_reviews.text: I had just let my kids use the last of these for a sleepover. They were at least 7 years old! They put out an awesome amount of useful light for at least 12hours. They actually stayed illuminated for approximately 16 hours. So I ordered more from Amazon, and when i received these, I was equally as pleased as I was with the ones I was replacing. See attached images for packaging and lot number/expiration dates. I would definitely purchase these again. I will update after using about 50% of the package I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: JuanonJuan

customer_reviews.title: Good to have on hand
customer_reviews.text: - Emergency light sticks - Poweroutages - its nice to be able to light up a room or hallway- these are bright and do last a long time before becoming too dull to be useful. It's always a good idea to have a box of these and the price is right.
customer_reviews.author: LG19Gamer

customer_reviews.title: Same brand as the Army uses
customer_reviews.text: Same brand I used in the military and have always worked for me. I've noticed that the shelf life exceeds the expiration date marked on package, of her by a couple years so rotate stock if you keep them on hand for go bag or emergencies.
customer_reviews.author: Papi

customer_reviews.title: Worked Well!
customer_reviews.text: We got these for our tornado shelter but ended up having them in our house when the power went out a while ago in the middle of the night. I was able to use one to calm down my scared children and I put it in the hallway between their three bedrooms and it provided enough light for a nice night light type glow in their rooms. It stayed lit all night.
customer_reviews.author: RAG

customer_reviews.title: Still good after 8 years on the shelf
customer_reviews.text: I bought a 10-pack of these a little over 8 years ago according to my Amazon history. They have come in handy during power outages but I still had several left and after such a long time I was unsure if they would still work and have good brightness and life. So, I snapped one to life and was pleased to discover that the performance was as good as when I bought them. I have been very satisfied with them, they are bright and long-lasting, consistent, and also have excellent shelf life.
customer_reviews.author: electronicaaddict

customer_reviews.title: These are handy to have around in several situations.
customer_reviews.text: Useful in an emergency and convenient around a tent site at night. They give enough light for enough time to slurp down dinner and a cup of coffee or tea and then they slowly fade over maybe 8 hours. Just hang it from the gear loft in your tent as a night light. It won't be enough to keep you awake but it will allow you to see if you need to get up during the night. The ones I received are genuine Cyalume sticks with a "use by" date of 2021. I intend to keep them in the house as part of an emergency kit and I'll throw one in my backpack for each night I'm on the trail.
customer_reviews.author: Barnacle Bill The Sailor

customer_reviews.title: versatile Snap Light sticks
customer_reviews.text: These snap lights are very useful when travelling. We typically use a snap light in our hotel/motel room so that we don't run into the furniture during the night. When you are travelling and in unfamiliar rooms, they provide just enough light to let you avoid stubbing your toes or running into furniture. We have found that the soft light emitted by the light sticks is superior to leaving a light on in the room.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas

customer_reviews.title: When the lights go out in TX
customer_reviews.text: Had a chance a few weeks ago to use these for the first time. Power went out in the latest TX storm. My daughter is afraid of the dark and when all the power is out it is DARK. I cracked one and shook it up and it was very bright. She was concerned about how long it would last but by morning about 10 hrs later it was still going. Like these so much I just bought another package.
customer_reviews.author: John Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Love these things. I buy all colors when they drop to 10 dollars or less per box. At that point they cost less or the same (tax) as dollar store ones but are much better. Nice and bright, although brightness varies by color. Always use one as a nightlight in our tent, tie one to the dogs collar, and let the kids play with them. I also keep one of each color in all vehicles and backpacks, just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: Not nearly as bright as I would have hoped.
customer_reviews.text: I had hoped to use these for either lighting my way at events or maybe create a moderately lit area during power outages. They hardly more effective than the glow bracelets you would buy for children.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, bright
customer_reviews.text: We usually give glow bracelets out for Halloween and use glow sticks for trick or treating. Nice and bright, used for a few hours then gave away to some kids, so not sure how long it lasted. Put a few in the car and the rest are put away. There is an expiration date so pay attention to that. These aren't very expensive but would be bad to need it and they don't work.
customer_reviews.author: larisa

customer_reviews.title: Good for home and car
customer_reviews.text: These are really good to have around. I keep a few in my car just in case if I break down, along with in my emergency kit in the house and few extra for if the powers goes out. They stay bright for quite a while and came in handy when the power went out, we have animals so I tend not to want to use candles. I keep them in my emergency kit for the house because until I make sure the gas is shut off from the outside and the place properly ventilated I do not want to have an open flame after a major earthquake.
customer_reviews.author: Mackenzie

customer_reviews.title: A must for every VEDC
customer_reviews.text: They're glowsticks, they glow for at least 8 hours at full brightness. If you own a car you need a pack of these, if you have a BOB you need a pack of these, it's better to have a pack of these and not need them than it is to need a pack of these and not have them. They'll also last forever.
customer_reviews.author: Sink

customer_reviews.title: Ya these are bright.
customer_reviews.text: Holy wow these are bright. Compared to other glow sticks these are the brightest I've seen. I was surprised a little and glad that it matched up with the way I thought they would be. The plastic is thicker they are individually packaged with a lot of air in it so it would do well packed in a backpack. I got the green ones and green always seem to be the brightest glowstick. Will buy again. Works better than the cowbell at night to keep track of the kid.
customer_reviews.author: Prescott

customer_reviews.title: WORSE THAN A DOLLAR STORE GLOW STICK
customer_reviews.text: These are a waste of money they do not light up any area at all.. i cracked two to test them and they were different brightness.... they are only good for up close use.... absolutely horrible and military grade my ARCE!!!! these are garbage. i want my money back
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Black

customer_reviews.title: Bright for about five hours and then the fire nation attacks
customer_reviews.text: Not as bright as I expected them to be, but they do their job. They don't last full brightness for twelve hours, as the vibrancy started tapering off at around the five hour mark. The glow stick was practically useless by the eleventh hour, though there was some light. That being said, these glow sticks are great for camping, though I wouldn't suggest them for any cave exploring or your main source of light. The reach of the light isn't far either, which isn't too surprising, but is why I don't suggest them for cave exploration.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: long lasting.  great for camping
customer_reviews.text: bright for half an hour, then slightly less bright for another 8hrs, then low level brightness for another 7hrs. surprised how long these stay glowing. would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Denae M. Merrill

customer_reviews.title: Great product to have for just in case.
customer_reviews.text: Product is as advertised. Simple to store and have around house and car. Have used these while broken down on side of the road and at home during power outages. Cheap enough to have them in lots of places for just in case. Very bright to light up a room to be able to maneuver. I have never tried to read with one but if you held it above a map or book I am sure you could.
customer_reviews.author: A Lee

customer_reviews.title: Met Expectations
customer_reviews.text: Just used these on a camping trip to Vermont. I used them to hang on trees around the perimeter of our camp site for a bit of ambiance and to keep our bearings in the dark. Bright enough, and they last for the full twelve hours. Lightweight and easy to store/carry in a backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Manhattan

customer_reviews.title: Better than I remember
customer_reviews.text: Brighter than the lightsticks I remember, and worth more than I paid for them. I've already given a few to friends for their emergency supply kits. When the time comes, I'll simply click on 'Order Again.' Up to 30hrs of use (15hrs of light, then pale glow) Bright enough for a single room (12' x 11') - if you don't need to read, then it needs to be on you Shaking vigorously and quickly mixes reactants fully Easiest wrapped product to open Minimalist packaging - VERY important to me Durable - dog tried playing with one, no bite marks, scratches, or dents
customer_reviews.author: Joshua W. Maupin

customer_reviews.title: Yes, they are very bright and last a long time.
customer_reviews.text: At the large annual family camp-out in the northern woods of Michigan, there are two outhouses and one is a few hundred feet into the woods down a narrow trail. I hung these up on branches each night along the path leading to the far outhouse and it worked perfectly. Many long time attendees had actually forgotten about the existence of this outhouse and it suddenly became useful to them again, especially at night when the (excessive drinking and eating of Michiganders at camp-out) leads to much increased outhouse use. Also, the kids love these things.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lane

customer_reviews.title: A must have product
customer_reviews.text: Great buy and a must have product. You should have them in house for emergency like blackout. Great to use for mark locations in dark. Use for children who are afraid of dark, to help get over their fear. These are a product that all households must have.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Typical light sticks, not "industrial'
customer_reviews.text: These work as expected, but I seem to have a 15% failure rate where sticks are dead even though they are long away from expiration dates. IE, keep a couple wherever you'd like to use them just in case. At an avg of $1 per stick, I'll deal with the bad/dead sticks. Not worth returns or complaints unless the frequency of bad sticks continue or rises. Great for camping, power outages, tool boxes and for situations where a flame or electric spark could produce a fire or other hazardous situations.
customer_reviews.author: GH

customer_reviews.title: Not as bright as others we have ordered
customer_reviews.text: Previously we have ordered these Chem lights. They seem to be much brighter than this set. We use them on the boat when we are anchored to provide light to walk around the boat with out attracting bugs. Order these instead -
customer_reviews.author: WVTERP

customer_reviews.title: 12 hours means 12 hours of 100% output
customer_reviews.text: I had these same 12 hour light sticks that expired in 2010, and I activated it to see how well they worked. I was super happy that they still illuminated the room for well over 12 hours with no dulling of brightness. I had them in our camping supplies and now have new ones that don't expire until year 2025-but I know they are good well after that date. When camping, they are bright enough to walk down the clear path to the restroom with one in hand. As much light as one puts off, I expect they will be wonderful to use in my home during power outages, and so much safer than candles in kids rooms.
customer_reviews.author: Parkoff

customer_reviews.title: Completely useless
customer_reviews.text: These were completely useless. Not one single stick in the whole box put out enough light to see anything an inch away.
customer_reviews.author: Nilpo

customer_reviews.title: Decent run time, brightness not super
customer_reviews.text: Picked these up to wear on my hydration vest at night during an 100 mile race and they served the purpose of keeping me lit up and visible. The burn time was decent, several hours but the brightness wasn't on par with other brands I've used. YMMV.
customer_reviews.author: TREX

customer_reviews.title: Awesome chem lights
customer_reviews.text: I really like the fact that in an emergency where there is no power I can snap 3 or 4 of these and have lit bathrooms, hallways, and stairwells. I live in a hurricane and thunderstorm prone area, so its really nice knowing we arent gonna be those people left in the dark.
customer_reviews.author: Bacon Von Baconstien

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these light sticks to save for an emergency. On Halloween night, I decided to activate one to put on the porch for added light for the trick or treaters. It is still going strong after 28 hours. I cannot believe it has stayed bright for that long. I am purchasing another bag of these.
customer_reviews.author: JUDITH BARTON

customer_reviews.title: Light up your way anywhere!
customer_reviews.text: What’s not to like? Great product to keep in a pocketbook, dresser drawer beside the bed, in your car, Anywhere you might need a Quik light if a torch is not available. Last 12 or more hours. So easy a small child can make them work, also safe.
customer_reviews.author: Susan E. Howell

customer_reviews.title: Work great, almost 5 year lifespan.
customer_reviews.text: I have some of the mil spec versions around, so when I got these, I carefully compared them. Identical appearance, length, and even weight. I suspect that to guarantee that they meet mil specs, the manufacturer simply shortens the GUARANTEED lifespan for those sold to the military. After all, the military one are often stored in bad locations, high temps, really low temps, etc., so it makes sense to provide a shorter guaranteed life. They work great. We keep a couple in each car, for emergencies. We also keep them in our evacuation kit. We use them annually in Halloween decorations.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Povey

customer_reviews.title: Starting the glow was extremely easy. Glow did last pretty much up to the ...
customer_reviews.text: Glowsticks are of impeccable CyaLume manufacturing standards. Starting the glow was extremely easy. Glow did last pretty much up to the 8 hour duration of light reported by the manufacturer. Uses are many, from entertainment, to additional lighting, to using glowstick as a beacon by which to attract the attention of Search/Rescue efforts. Make up your own decision about the MDMA part :) Would Highly Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Essential for Camping
customer_reviews.text: I use these primarily for camping. You can wear one around your neck for personal visibility, have it in your tent or travel trailer as a night light, and most importantly, on tent guy lines near the stakes so that people don't trip over them at night. And yes, they are illuminated all night long. Preparing for a recent camping trip, I found a stash of these that had been packed away for years...snap! and they still worked!
customer_reviews.author: Llamamadre

customer_reviews.title: Bright, last 12+ hours
customer_reviews.text: The green gives the most lumens, but is a gentle light that doesn't hurt your eyes at night. Last all night long. Great for camping or for black-outs. Kids love them and feel more secure with them. Great night lights for camping. Great alternative to flashlights. Cheap, waterproof, safe. Buy a whole pack and put a few in each car, a home emergency kit, and a camper. Just get them. Easy decision.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Work the way they should plenty of light
customer_reviews.text: Work they way they should plenty of light all night. I put them on the floor of the pop up for late night broom runs. Down there it is dim enough to be a perfect night light. For more light we put it under a full water judge on the table and it lit up the pop up with enough light to get around but not read. For that we just did the same thing with a head lamp or bit the bullet and tuned the lights on. Also use them back packing to mark tie downs on tents and to find camp sites easily. Fun to throw around.
customer_reviews.author: Tree Climber

customer_reviews.title: Best That I've Ever Bought
customer_reviews.text: After receiving these, I immediately tested one out. I planned on packing them with my emergency gear and wanted to know what to expect - I was surprised. The one stick that I activated let off a bright glow for twelve hours, and had residual glow for about seventy-eight hours in 21C (70F) weather. For those curious, I purposefully bought green for my emergency gear because green is supposedly the color that the rods in your eyes (which is the part of your eye more developed for night vision) pick up the most. Even if these don't last as long for other people as they did for me, eleven dollars for ten is a steal.
customer_reviews.author: F. H.

customer_reviews.title: For emergencies
customer_reviews.text: I used this product to build an emergency kit for the house. I cracked one open and it worked fine and lasted long. The expiration date is far from now but I like how long it last and the price.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Always lasts longer than 12 hours - go with the name brand
customer_reviews.text: Reliable light sticks from Cyalume SnapLight cost more than the knock off's but really last longer and are brighter. We've had light from these still visible the following evening - 24 hours later.
customer_reviews.author: B Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Only glow sticks I trust
customer_reviews.text: The only glow sticks I trust!!! We got a few different brands for my son and they leaked. He ended up getting the liquid in his eyes because they leaked into his hands. The only glow sticks o will buy from now on!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Cosklo

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Cracked easy and was bright lasted less than 18 hours
customer_reviews.author: Julieth

customer_reviews.title: for the car emergency kit
customer_reviews.text: Out of sight, but not out of mind. I travel quite a bit back and forth to the coast over mountain roads, which can often get pummeled with rain or snow without much warning. Having lighting in the car "just in case" something happens brings a sigh of relief. Easily tucks away into the emergency kit. Hoping I never have to use it - but it's exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: the best
customer_reviews.text: 1 is new, 1 is 2 years expired and still going strong. great to tie to kids when camping to check on them easily. my kids green, yours red, easy to count in the dark at a distance
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: super bright and useful
customer_reviews.text: purchased for a camping trip and general preparedness around the house, super bright and useful, lasted the entire night and aided in many campsite needs such as marking the latrine and tents
customer_reviews.author: Tony Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Bright and long lasting!
customer_reviews.text: I use chem lights all the time when camping. I like to string one up on my hammock ridge line so that folks don't trip over the guy lines and it gives a nice glow to the area. I will keep buying these as long as they keep selling them!
customer_reviews.author: Andy Lundberg

customer_reviews.title: Great supply, but only in a bag
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these. Great as a survival or emergency kit supply. Also this is good for kids, they seem to be drawn to them like flies to....well you know. These are not the non-toxic and glass free setup, so make sure that any child who has it will not be chewing them open. They do come in one bag of 20, loosely packed. they don't just flop around, but there is no protection against accidental activation. As of yet I have not had a problem, but I haven't used many. although unlikely, there is that chance. Maybe thin box would have been better.
customer_reviews.author: L. McNerneyTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: Camping buddy
customer_reviews.text: Worked for the camping trip, girl used one per night as a sleep night light.
customer_reviews.author: Aqwarius

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality very heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: Good Quality very heavy duty. Exactly as advertised. We used this for making the rescue Kayaks more visible at night during a 54 mile swim. The Chem lights lasted the entire time as advertised. Units were used above and below water for up 12 hours. Easily attached for use by a small hole in the top of the light. This is now part of my everyday use, and will be in my back pack and home.
customer_reviews.author: William McHenry

customer_reviews.title: 2+ year old sticks worked great last weekend
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of the some product. I'm actually reviewing the sticks I bought over two years ago which I finally just broke out and used during a camping trip. They worked great! Lot's of light for 6+ hours...it was daylight after that, so I don't know how much longer they lasted. Note that these sticks serve a dual purpose when camping with kids. Obviously they supply portable reliable temporary light. They also supply endless hours of fun for the kids, and they help you keep track of the little buggers and their friends.
customer_reviews.author: Zarasa

customer_reviews.title: excellant product
customer_reviews.text: You can definitely tell the difference between these and the cheap ones. These are so bright. we use them in our pool for late night swimming :)
customer_reviews.author: Susanne maiberger

customer_reviews.title: Top of the line
customer_reviews.text: After reading almost all of their review, I decided to give this product ago. I am very happy with it. The light is bright and for the first 4 hours didnt lose the brightness.
customer_reviews.author: daryoush farhani

customer_reviews.title: super bright! lasts hours
customer_reviews.text: I broke one of these at 7pm and just left it to see how long it would stay bright, and when I went to bed at midnight, it was exactly as bright, and even at 2am when I got up to pee it was still glowing pretty decently. Got up again at 5:30am and it was pretty dim but not dead yet!
customer_reviews.author: Brie ford

customer_reviews.title: Great safety item for working after dark.
customer_reviews.text: Great safety item when working after dark. Purchased the pack to keep fellow co-workers safe, even with poor vision there was no question of ground personnel location.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great camping toys for the kids
customer_reviews.text: We give these to the kids when camping. Lets you know where they are in the dark and they also get a little night light for the tent. So far, they have lasted about 30 hours for us. I always keep them stocked in the camp gear.
customer_reviews.author: djtal79

customer_reviews.title: Very bright
customer_reviews.text: Very bright, excellent for casual use or emergencies. I use them occasionally when I ride trails at night to mark where I left my bag. Can be seen from distance with no problem
customer_reviews.author: Zachary J.

customer_reviews.title: Nice and bright
customer_reviews.text: Nice and bright. We used to use these for camping when I was a kid. Nowadays you can buy cheap-o ones at the local Tar/Wals, but they're not the same. These have an integrated hook and loophole, as opposed to the cheap ones that just have separate cap. I buy these because when I take my young kids camping, I can firmly attach these to their clothes so I can see them at night. Plan to do the same thing for Halloween coming up.
customer_reviews.author: Paco

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for emergencies!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these to replace the old ones I have in all of my emergency kits and inside my RV. I snapped one to test it out and it lasts a lot longer than I thought it would. Light was still sufficient the next day! Exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Kasee Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Go nowhere with out them
customer_reviews.text: Best deal on FANTASTIC lights! Place a few in the glovebox! I work in law enforcement and pass them out to citizens all the time! Great for emergency use in the car or for a power failure at home. I hood them on my uniform when out directing traffic at crashes on a major 6 lane freeway. Minimizes to chances of no being seen! Good to keep a fer dozen on hand - great gifts for other Officers you meet at scenes during the night hours! 1*
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Pocock

customer_reviews.title: Safe and bright!
customer_reviews.text: These lights are always a must for any type of night time power outage. The green lights tend to last longer for some reason and the length of the light can be extended by a few hours if run under warm/hot water. Don't put it into boiling water or melt the plastic, but you will extend the life and amount of light by several hours. They are perfect for the elderly that may have problems using a lighter or matches and safer due to the lack of heat or an open flame. The next time the power goes out overnight or for a few days, just put one of the babies in the bathroom and you are good to "GO"!
customer_reviews.author: G. Evans

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra cash
customer_reviews.text: I have used glow sticks for years for marking our gear during the night time, or in addition to my dog's reflective vest and various other things. I've always picked them up for about $.50 each and only got about 6 hours of light. A friend of mine recommended these and I bit the bullet and bought some. Way brighter than what I have been using and lasts way longer than any I have ever used. Will be using these from now on
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding bright light output. Great safety help during an emergency.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product. Even very bright during the day which I had to try once I received the package for test run. Not sure on some of those negative reviews. This light stick is great and high light output even during the daylight. Very pleasantly surprised.
customer_reviews.author: hank

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is the loop at the top is kinda small which made shoving paracord through it challenging to tie it to my pack. Functionally these lights work great - very happy overall
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Overstreet

customer_reviews.title: Very Bright (Glad that I bought it)
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pack of the Green and had an occasion to use one on Halloween to help my daughter. It was much brighter than any similar stick we'd used before and was still pretty bright by the time she went to sleep several hours later. I passed by her room in the morning and it was still on some 11 hours later. Now these are going to become a part of our Emergency Road Kit and our backpacks for when we go hiking/camping.
customer_reviews.author: Dan JTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Still usable 24 hours later
customer_reviews.text: Great for attaching to something to make it visible at night (duh)... They're easily seen from at least 200 yards away at night (verified). Right at 24 hours later, they still glow more than enough for marking or signaling. I'd say they put out just barely enough light for you to see where you're going or to see everything in a dark room if the power is out. I'll definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: CEWILLI

customer_reviews.title: Great package deal
customer_reviews.text: I am partial to the green sticks as I have used them many times in the past. They emit the right amount of light and yet will not give your position away if you are careful. The length of light time is variable depending on, of course, the individual stick, ambient temperature etc. Great way to start collecting an alternant light source.
customer_reviews.author: Edward D. Allen, MSW

customer_reviews.title: Regular not super bright
customer_reviews.text: Really not that bright, it was my understanding that these were one of the brightest out there, but seems just regualer to me. Works, but not that bright.
customer_reviews.author: Obake

customer_reviews.title: As advertised...
customer_reviews.text: I bought some of these chemlights to keep on hand in case of an emergency. They make great signaling devices, light sources, etc. all without the dangers of heat or flame. I cracked one open to test them out to see if they're worth getting more of. I was pleasantly surprised.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Bug Out Bag essential
customer_reviews.text: Got these for the family’s bug out bags. No batteries required. Good light source if needed in an emergency. Do recommend all houses have these on hand. Quick delivery. Would order from again!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth H. Spangler

customer_reviews.title: Def worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! Def worth the investment!!!! Had to crack one open just to see how bright they were and let's face it I'm a guy I'm just a big kid!! Good for emergency situations or just to throw in your edc or bob to have if needed
customer_reviews.author: walter wiseman

customer_reviews.title: These things are amazing
customer_reviews.text: These things are the best glow sticks I've ever used. They last forever and on top of that are the brightest things you can buy. Really easy to snap but not so easy it will on accident and really durable.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Huegel

customer_reviews.title: Cyalume SnapLight Green Light Sticks - 6 Inch
customer_reviews.text: Item works as described. They light up bright enough to actually see what you are doing. As they start to dim a bit during use, give them a good shake and they will brighten back up - unless the light stick in nearing the end of its cycle. I use these while Catfishing during the night. I hang one of these on a pole next to the back of my truck so that I am able to see all my fishing gear. So far, so good. I will order more as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Ozarks Airgunner

customer_reviews.title: Illuminati my camp party
customer_reviews.text: I use these for when I go camping, and they last for probably 8 hrs. before they begin to dim to a point where you notice. They're all individually sealed which preserves them for years, and they're easy to activate; just snap them a few times. The hole at the top is a very nice addition, so I can just tie it around my neck and have my hands free. Of course, they don't beat a flashlight when focused, but they do illuminate a larger area than flashlights can.
customer_reviews.author: The Mountaineering Engineer

customer_reviews.title: I stumbled upon these while looking for some other camping ...
customer_reviews.text: I stumbled upon these while looking for some other camping products. I decided to give them a try as the only ones I have ever used are the Dollar Store units. I was impressed. One con is they do seem to start losing light about 1 hour into the illumination though. The units are bit longer than cheaper units but look the same. We have used them with the kids for things such as playing in the backyard at night with friends and Halloween. I do have a couple units in each of our vehicles just in case but have not had to use them.
customer_reviews.author: NotSoSimple

customer_reviews.title: Very handy!
customer_reviews.text: Our lights went out an hour or so the other night, I found our lantern, but needed more light to take with me to other rooms. These are perfect..
customer_reviews.author: S. Eden

customer_reviews.title: The best light sticks I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: Real Cyalume lights by SnapLight really are head and shoulders above the off brands. I conducted some tests, and vs a few other brands (including Mayday) the SnapLights are initially much brighter. They also maintain useful light considerably longer than the cheapo brands. I dunno why but the results were pretty clear. These cost slightly more but aside from novelty use (Halloween, concerts, etc) I'll never buy anything else again. My main use for these is camping and hiking. One will more than "burn" through the night so the extra expense is minimal. The reliability and performance are priceless.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C. Babcock

product_meta.title: Cyalume SnapLight Green Light Sticks – 6 Inch Industrial Grade, High Intensity Glow Sticks with 12 Hour Duration (Pack of 30)
product_meta.description: Size:30 PackThe Cyalume Snaplight Is A Green Industrial Grade Light Stick Measuring 6&Quot; Long, For Providing Instant 360 Degree Illumination, That Can Be Seen Up To A Mile Away For Up To 12 Hours In Optimal Conditions. The Snaplight Is Waterproof, Non-Toxic, And Non-Flammable. To Activate The Light Stick, Bend, Snap And Shake The Tube. The Light Stick Has A Hook And Gate Top, For Hanging Or Attaching The Light. Each Light Stick Is Individually Foil-Wrapped For Protection From Light And Moisture, And Has Up To A Five-Year Shelf Life From Date Of Manufacture.The Durable, Waterproof, External Body Of The Light Stick Is Made From Low Density Polyethylene (Ldpe), And Is Phthalate Free For Safety. The Internal Illuminating Substance Is Non-Toxic And Non-Flammable, And The Components Of The Light Stick Are Recyclable. The Light Stick Floats In Water And Works Best Between 40 To 80 Degrees F (4 To 27 Degrees C), And Although The Light Stick Works At Higher Or Lower Temperatures, It Is Less Effective In Colder Temperatures.All Sticks Are Tested At A Temperature Of 72 Degrees F (22 Degrees C) To Determine The Illumination Duration. Each 10-Degree C (50-Degree F) Increase Or Decrease In Temperature Doubles Or Halves The Reaction Rate, And Therefore The Brightness And Duration. For Example, The Same Light Stick That Emits Approximately 30 Lux (A Unit That Describes How Much Light Is Visible Over A Square Meter) At 15 Minutes After Activation At 24 Degrees C (75 Degrees F) Will Be Half As Bright But Glow Twice As Long At 14 Degrees C (57 Degrees F). At 34 Degrees C (93 Degrees F), The Same Light Stick Would Be Twice As Bright, But Glow Half As Long. Storage At Elevated Temperatures (Above 120 Degrees F Or 49 Degrees C) Will Decrease Shelf Life And Start To Soften The Plastic Tube, And Increase The Risk Of A Leak. Exposure To Cold Temperatures Will Not Affect The Light Sticks If They Are Warmed Above 40 Degrees F (4.5 Degrees C) Before Activation, Unless They Are Frozen (Which Occurs At -15 To -20 Degrees F, Or -26 To -29 Degrees C). Once Light Sticks Have Been Frozen, They Will Still Produce Some Light, But Performance Will Not Be As Reliable. Humidity And Atmospheric Conditions Do Not Affect The Light Sticks.Cyalume Technologies Manufactures Chemiluminescent Products Used For Safety, Industrial, And Military Applications. The Company, Founded In 1970 And Headquartered In West Springfield, Ma, Makes Products Under Chemlight And Snaplight Brands. Chemlight Products Meet Military Specifications, And The Company Meets Iso 9001 Standards.
feature_bullets: 12 HOURS OF BRIGHT LIGHT: Our patented, long-lasting formulations provide bright, high light output for up to 12 hours at a time, ensuring you have the light you need when electric light isn’t an option.

SAFE AND DURABLE: Industrial-grade construction means our light sticks are high quality and durable, plus they are waterproof, non-flammable and have a non-toxic chemistry. They’re an illumination product you can trust, and a great option to add to your emergency preparedness pack!

5-YEAR SHELF LIFE: Our SnapLight glow sticks have a guaranteed 5-year shelf life, and each are individually foil wrapped. You can safely store them for years without harm to the light stick or components.

VARIETY OF USES: Our light sticks can be used in a variety of situations, including as a flashlight alternative when camping, hunting or night fishing, as an emergency light in your car or home during power outages, for recreational use and much more. The possibilities are endless.

MADE IN THE USA: Our glow sticks are made in the US under strict quality guidelines, which guarantees consistent and excellent results in every product. Cyalume is known around the world for bringing light to dark places with our innovative emergency light solutions.
